title: How hit song 'Abraham, Martin and John' helped console a grieving nation
content: One listen was enough for an unimpressed Dion DiMucci to dismiss the song sent his way in the summer of 1968.    First, there were the lyrics: Invoking the still open wounds of the April assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. and the June murder of Robert Kennedy.    And the arrangement: The demo version...
